title: Replace new TBird Profile with earlier one
content:
About a month ago I began the process of upgrading from W10 to W11. In the process, several problems happened. One of the problems was with Firefox. After reading and trying many suggestions from the Mozilla site, as well as several other sites, and having no success, I posted my problem on this Mozilla support site and hope that there was someone who could help. There was. After several days of exchanging messages (suggestions, instructions and results - mostly about Profile), Firefox returned.

The other major problem is Thunderbird. I have downloaded a current version (128.5.2esr). I have run it twice and, each time, email was downloaded. So that part seems to be working. What doesn’t appear are the settings I have used and message folders I have created over several years. I suspect that the problems are Profile related.

Starting from Help in the Thunderbird menu, then Troubleshooting Information, then Application Basics, I see Profile Folder. On that line is a button labeled Open Folder followed by (Local Drive). I click Open Folder and File Explorer opens to a folder named ab3xaztm.default-esr. It shows that the folder contains 59 items, including 10 subfolders. All files and folders show a December date.

Following the path C:\Users\rsuth\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\, in addition to ab3x…, there is another folder nlys3gkl.default that contains only 1 file, times.json.

Because of my earlier struggle – and eventual win – with the Firefox problem, I think that the Thunderbird problem might also be fixed in a similar way: Profile.

Slightly before the upgrading from W10 to W11, I made a copy of my Thunderbird folder. I think if I replace the currently active Thunderbird folder with the one I have saved, my Thunderbird problem may be over. However, I’m not certain that will happen and I’m not certain about the specific steps to take to make the replacement. (With my Firefox issue, there were a couple of small important steps I had to take to make it work, and those steps were explained to me by the person who helped me with my Firefox problem. So, after all these words, can someone point me in the direction to solve my Thunderbird problem?

Thanks for reading.
creator: I_Rufus

title: separate auth and enc keys in Thunderbird PGP
content:
Can Thunderbird (128.5.1) use separate authentication and encryption keys (generated w/ gnupg)?

I updated my thunderbird config to allow external gnupg key, but when I try to add the key files, it rejects them. I did find on FAQ there is requirement that authentication and encryption have to be the same key. This seems a bit restrictive given that a user should have one set of keys. I have keys I generated via gnupg w/ use of a card.
creator: matt.wette

title: snap Thunderbird problems
content:
I am using Thunderbird on my Ubuntu desktop to access rich02@board18.org on my DreamHost shared server. this has worked fine for years. But then I upgraded Ubuntu to release 24.04.1. This release of Ubuntu switched to a Snap package for Thunderbird. Since then I have been experiencing a lot of errors [IE: Mail text not showing on screen, unable to save messages to sent file, messages sent by others not arriving on my laptop, etc.]. I also use Thunderbird to access a gmail account which has none of these errors. If I access rich02@board18.org from other [non Thunderbird] mail clients I see none of these errors. This problem is only in Thunderbird.

I have searched Thunderbird help and support sites and found no mention of this issue anywhere. Do you have any suggestions about this?

Also the snap/thunderbird directories shown below are all empty.

richpri46@system76-pc:~$ ls ~/snap/thunderbird 585 593 common current richpri46@system76-pc:~$ ls ~/snap/thunderbird/common richpri46@system76-pc:~$ ls ~/snap/thunderbird/593 richpri46@system76-pc:~$ ls ~/snap/thunderbird/585 richpri46@system76-pc:~$

Am I looking in the wrong place for the thunderbird profile files.
creator: richpri46

That's how TB installed after downloading.

I am not a newbie, and have been using Eudora then TB since the late 20th century.

title: "Unable to open folder inbox on xxxxx@earthlink.net because it is in use by some other operation." on startup
content: For two weeks now, I've been receiving the following error message whenever I open Thunderbird: "Unable to open folder inbox on xxxxx@earthlink.net because it is in use by some other operation. Please wait for that operation to finish and then select the folder again." I have no idea what operation it may be referring to. I still get this message if Thunderbird is the first thing I open when I turn the computer on. I can see my email on Earthlink, but it is a very awkward program, with no way to mark email important, and other problems. For years I've had messages automatically downloaded to Thunderbird, and this problem never happened before. Other details: I am able to send messages on Thunderbird. I am using an older computer with Windows 10. Thank you! Paul Geidel
creator: PaulieG324
